sect2.title: Sidecar files
sect2.para: darktable is a non-destructive image editor. This implies that darktable opens input images read-only. Any newly added metadata, tags and parameters of image operations are stored in a separate file, a so called sidecar or XMP file. Each input image has its own sidecar file residing in the same folder as the input file with a filename constructed in the form <basename>.<extension>.xmp. Sidecar files get synchronized automatically by darktable without the need to press a save button. When backing up your data, make sure you also save the XMP file, as this is needed to fully reconstruct your work in case of a disaster.
In addition to the sidecar files darktable keeps all image related data in its database for fast access.
